Module: j5e/animation

Description

The j5e Animation module handles tweening between a series of key frames. Works with with the LED, RGB, and Servo classes.

Requires

  • module:j5e/fn
  • module:j5e/event

Class: Animation

Allows for scripted control of LEDs, RGBs, and Servos

Constructor

new Animation()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
target
(required)
Object
Array.<Object>
Device (LED, RGB, or Servo) or an array of devices to be animated (See instantiation for more information)

Example

// Make a servo "wave"
import Servo from "j5e/servo";
import Animation from "j5e/animation";

const servo = await new Servo(13);
const ani = await new Animation(servo);

const wave = {
  duration: 4000,
  cuePoints: [0,  0.375, 0.625, 1],
  keyFrames: [0, 135, 45, 180],
  loop: true,
  metronomic: true
};

ani.enqueue(wave);

Events

  • animation:pause
  • animation:stop

Methods

enqueue

Add an animation segment to the animation queue (See {@tutorial D-ANIMATING} for more information)

animation.enqueue()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
options
(required)
object
Animation segment options
options.keyFrames
(required)
Array.<object>
Values for each cuepoint
options.cuePoints
Array.<number>
Segment cuepoints from 0-1
Default: [0, 1]
options.duration
number
Duration of segment in ms
Default: 1000
options.easing
fuction
Easing function to use for segment
Default: linear()
options.loop
boolean
If true the segment will loop back
options.loopback
number
The time to loop back to [0-1]
Default: 0
options.metronomic
boolean
Instead of looping back to the beginning it will reverse direction at the end of the segment
options.currentSpeed
number
The playback speed [0-1]
Default: 1
options.progress
number
The current progress
options.fps
number
Frames per second
Default: 50
options.rate
number
ms between frames
Default: 20
options.paused
boolean
Wether the animation is in a paused state
options.onstart
function
Function to call when the segment starts
options.onpause
function
Function to call when the segment is paused
options.onstop
function
Function to call when the segment is stopped
options.oncomplete
function
Function to call when the segment is complete
options.onloop
function
Function to call when the segment loops

Example

Make a servo "wave"
import Servo from "j5e/servo";
import Animation from "j5e/animation";

const servo = await new Servo(13);
const ani = await new Animation(servo);

const wave = {
  duration: 4000,
  cuePoints: [0,  0.375, 0.625, 1],
  keyFrames: [0, 135, 45, 180],
  loop: true,
  metronomic: true
};

ani.enqueue(wave);

next

Plays next segment in queue. Not meant to be called externally.

animation.next()

Returns: this

play

Resume play on an animation after it has been paused or stopped.

animation.play()

Returns: Animation

Example

Make a servo "wave" for five seconds, pause for one second and then resume waving
import Servo from "j5e/servo";
import Animation from "j5e/animation";
import {timer} from "j5e/fn";

const servo = await new Servo(13);
const ani = await new Animation(servo);

const wave = {
  duration: 4000,
  cuePoints: [0,  0.375, 0.625, 1],
  keyFrames: [0, 135, 45, 180],
  loop: true,
  metronomic: true
};

ani.enqueue(wave);

timer.setTimeout(function() {
  ani.pause();
}, 5000);

timer.setTimeout(function() {
  ani.play();
}, 6000);

pause

Pause animation while maintaining progress, speed and segment queue

animation.pause()

Returns: Animation

Example

Make a servo "wave" for five seconds, pause for one second and then resume waving
import Servo from "j5e/servo";
import Animation from "j5e/animation";
import {timer} from "j5e/fn";

const servo = await new Servo(13);
const ani = await new Animation(servo);

const wave = {
  duration: 4000,
  cuePoints: [0,  0.375, 0.625, 1],
  keyFrames: [0, 135, 45, 180],
  loop: true,
  metronomic: true
};

ani.enqueue(wave);

timer.setTimeout(function() {
  ani.pause();
}, 5000);

timer.setTimeout(function() {
  ani.play();
}, 6000);

stop

Stop the animation, flushing the segment queue

animation.stop()

Returns: Animation

Example

Make a servo "wave" for five seconds and then stop, flushing the queue
import Servo from "j5e/servo";
import Animation from "j5e/animation";
import {timer} from "j5e/fn";

const servo = await new Servo(13);
const ani = await new Animation(servo);

const wave = {
  duration: 4000,
  cuePoints: [0,  0.375, 0.625, 1],
  keyFrames: [0, 135, 45, 180],
  loop: true,
  metronomic: true
};

ani.enqueue(wave);

timer.setTimeout(function() {
  ani.stop();
}, 5000);

speed

Get or set the current playback speed

animation.speed()

Returns: Animation

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
speed
Number
The desired playback speed (1 = normal)

Example

Make a servo "wave" for one second, increase the speed, wait another second and decrease the speed for one second and then stop.
import Servo from "j5e/servo";
import Animation from "j5e/animation";
import {timer} from "j5e/fn";

const servo = await new Servo(13);
const ani = await new Animation(servo);

const wave = {
  duration: 4000,
  cuePoints: [0,  0.375, 0.625, 1],
  keyFrames: [0, 135, 45, 180],
  loop: true,
  metronomic: true
};

ani.enqueue(wave);

timer.setTimeout(function() {
  ani.speed(2.0); // Speed up to 2x
}, 1000);

timer.setTimeout(function() {
  ani.speed(0.5); // Speed up to 1/2x
}, 2000);

timer.setTimeout(function() {
  ani.stop(); // Note, animation speed is still 0.5
}, 3000);

loopFunction

Called in each frame of the animation

animation.loopFunction()

findIndices

Find left and right cuepoints.

animation.findIndices()

calculateProgress

Compute progress based on start time.

animation.calculateProgress()

tweenedValue

Find our tweened value based on left and right indices and current progress.

animation.tweenedValue()

normalizeKeyframes

Make sure our keyframes conform to a standard.

animation.normalizeKeyframes()

on

Create an event listener

animation.on()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
event
(required)
string
The name of the event to listen for
listener
(required)
function
A callback to run when the event is fired.

removeListener

Remove an event listener

animation.removeListener()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
event
(required)
string
The name of the event that we are removing a listener from
listener
(required)
function
The callback that we are removing

emit

Emit an event

animation.emit()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
event
(required)
string
The name of the event to emit

once

Create an event listener that will only fire one time.

animation.once()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
event
(required)
string
The name of the event to listen for
listener
(required)
function
A callback to run when the event is fired.

Class: Timer

Local wrapper class for managing the timer

Constructor

new Timer()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
animation
(required)
object
The animation instance

Methods

Class: Segment
